Мнемоника

purpleculture_examples:
官吏 [ guān lì ]: bureaucrat; official
贪官污吏 [ tān guān wū lì ]: grasping officials, corrupt mandarins (idiom); abuse and corruption
吏治 [ lì zhì ]: style of governing (of minor official); achievement in office
狱吏 [ yù lì ]: prison guard; jailer (old)
吏部 [ lì bù ]: Ministry of Appointments (in imperial China)

humanum_full_description_en:
" History ," " officials ", " what ", " make " this is the word of differentiation. Oracle from " hand " from " ◎ ". Yu Shengwu believes that the difference between " li " and " history " is that the upper end of the vertical line of " li " is divided into two forks. Ji Xusheng thought that the meaning of the word " official " came from the extension of " history ", and later, in order to make the character shape different, he differentiated the word " official ". However, there is no obvious difference in the usage of " history " and " officials " in the oracle bone inscriptions, and there is no example of using " officials " to represent officials. See " History ".

Most of the bronze inscriptions use the non-branched font as " history " and the branched font as " officials " (same as " things "). (Refer to "General Explanation of Bronze Forms and Meanings", "Commonly Used Bronze Dictionary", "New Bronze Compilation", Chen Yingjie) See " Things ". According to the character form of Xiaozhuan, "Shuowen" thinks that the word "吏" starts from "一" from " historical ". "Said Wen": "The official, the one who governs the people. From the history, the history also sounds." From the early fonts, the " officials " in the Warring States period are not from the " one ".

"Wen said," that " officials " of the original meaning is a generic term officials. Examples in ancient books such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The First Year of Zhao Gong": "If you are a group of officials, if you don't get rid of pollution or escape, what are the problems?" "Mandarin. Zhou Yushang": "The king is an envoy, Situ Xianjie, the public, the officials, and the common people." Wei Zhao's note: "A hundred officials, a hundred officials."

" Officials " After the multi represent lower-level officials, such as petty officials or servants. Such as "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Eighteen Kinds of Laws of the Qin Dynasty" Jian 128: "Officials and officials use bulls and cattle to give their lunar eclipses and bulls to ride horses. It is awkward." It means that officials and officials can receive their monthly rations and rations in official ox carts. The officials have feed for driving cattle and horses. Another example is "Historical Records. "Biography of the Xiongnu": "The Handu River runs from the west of Shuofang to Lingju. It often leads to the canal and sets up fields. The officials and servants of 50,000 to 60,000 soldiers cannibalize the land to the north of the Huns."
humanum_short_description_en: " History ," " officials ", " what ", " make " this is the word of differentiation. Oracle from " hand " from " ◎ ". Yu Shengwu believes that the difference between " li " and " history " is that the upper end of the vertical line of " li " is divided into two forks. "Wen said," that " officials " of the original meaning is a generic term officials.
humanum_full_description:
「史」、「吏」、「事」、「使」本為一字分化。甲骨文從「手」從「◎」。于省吾以為「吏」和「史」的分別在於「吏」的豎劃上端分作兩叉形。季旭昇以為「吏」的字義來自「史」的引申，後來為了讓字形有區別，於是分化出「吏」字。但甲骨文中「史」、「吏」的用法未見明顯分別，亦未見用「吏」表示官吏的辭例。參見「史」。

　　金文大多以不分杈字形為「史」，分杈字形為「吏」（同「事」）。（參《金文形義通解》、《金文常用字典》、《新金文編》、陳英傑）參見「事」。《說文》根據小篆的字形以為「吏」字從「一」從「史」。《說文》：「吏，治人者也。从一从史，史亦聲。」從早期字形看來，直至戰國文字的「吏」都不從「一」。

　　《說文》以為「吏」的本義是官員的通稱。古書中的例子如《左傳．昭公元年》：「若子之群吏，處不辟污，出不逃難，其何患之有？」《國語．周語上》：「王乃使司徒咸戒公卿、百吏、庶民。」韋昭注：「百吏，百官。」

　　「吏」後多表示較低級的官員，如胥吏或差役。如《睡虎地秦簡．秦律十八種》簡128：「官長及吏以公車牛稟其月食及公牛乘馬之稟，可殹。」意謂官長和吏可以用官有牛車領取自己每月的口糧和官有駕車牛馬的飼料。又如《史記．匈奴列傳》：「漢度河自朔方以西至令居，往往通渠置田，官吏卒五六萬人，稍蠶食，地接匈奴以北。」
humanum_short_description: 「史」、「吏」、「事」、「使」本為一字分化。甲骨文從「手」從「◎」。于省吾以為「吏」和「史」的分別在於「吏」的豎劃上端分作兩叉形。《說文》以為「吏」的本義是官員的通稱。

「 史 」、「 吏 」、「 事 」、「 使 」本為一字分化。甲骨文從「 手 」從「 ◎ 」。于省吾以為「 吏 」和「 史 」的分別在於「 吏 」的豎劃上端分作兩叉形。季旭昇以為「 吏 」的字義來自「 史 」的引申，後來為了讓字形有區別，於是分化出「 吏 」字。但甲骨文中「 史 」、「 吏 」的用法未見明顯分別，亦未見用「 吏 」表示官吏的辭例。參見「 史 」。 金文大多以不分杈字形為「 史 」，分杈字形為「 吏 」（同「 事 」）。（參《金文形義通解》、《金文常用字典》、《新金文編》、陳英傑）參見「 事 」。《說文》根據小篆的字形以為「 吏 」字從「 一 」從「 史 」。《說文》：「吏，治人者也。从一从史，史亦聲。」從早期字形看來，直至戰國文字的「 吏 」都不從「 一 」。 《說文》以為「 吏 」的本義是官員的通稱。古書中的例子如《左傳．昭公元年》：「若子之群吏，處不辟污，出不逃難，其何患之有？」《國語．周語上》：「王乃使司徒咸戒公卿、百吏、庶民。」韋昭注：「百吏，百官。」 「 吏 」後多表示較低級的官員，如胥吏或差役。如《睡虎地秦簡．秦律十八種》簡128：「官長及吏以公車牛稟其月食及公牛乘馬之稟，可殹。」意謂官長和吏可以用官有牛車領取自己每月的口糧和官有駕車牛馬的飼料。又如《史記．匈奴列傳》：「漢度河自朔方以西至令居，往往通渠置田，官吏卒五六萬人，稍蠶食，地接匈奴以北。」

However, there is no obvious difference in the usage of " history" and " officials" in the oracle bone inscriptions, and there is no example of using " officials" to represent officials. 吏字的基本解释

吏
lì
旧时代的大小官员：吏治。官吏。
旧指小公务员：吏员。胥吏（地方官府中办理文书的人）。

吏字的起名意思

官员的通称。也有治理，为官之意，如吏才，吏方。

Official
Basic explanation of words
Official
lì
Large and small officials in the old age: local officials. Official.
Old refers to small civil servants: officials. Subordinate staff (a person who handles documents in a local government office).
Official
Chinese dictionary definition of words
Official
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
Official
Source glyph
Official
Name meaning
The general name of an official. There is also the meaning of governing, being an official, such as being an official or an official.
lì
I сущ.
1) чиновник; правитель
吏民 чиновники и народ
天子之吏 правители (министры) Сына неба
贪官污吏 корыстолюбивые и алчные чиновники
2) мелкий чиновник; писец, письмоводитель, делопроизводитель; служитель
书吏 писец, письмоводитель, летописец
II собств.
Ли (фамилия)
